availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mordecai Walker (Greenup County, Kentucky, day laborer)

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, day laborer. Elliot County, Kentucky, native. Son of Mordecai Walker, Sr. and Margaret Archey Walker. Married to Margaret Walker. Father of Elizabeth Walker, Isabelle Walker, and Harriet A. Walker. Laborer in Carter County, Kentucky, in 1850. Day laborer in Greenup County in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 1, p. 280. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, Sub district 2, East Little Sandy, p. 76. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, Precinct 2, p. 49. Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates â€“ Microfilm (1911-1964), Greenup County, 1911, no. 3555, Microfilm rolls #7016130-7041803, Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky.
